column5: Any recent reports from Tetu island lodge. Fishing, lodge, staff? Any info appreciated. Blades
They have a great facebook page!I hear nothing but great things about Tetu Island Lodge. I highly recommend it to anyone fishing the north end of LOTW.

Unless there are two of them, Tetu Island Lodge is not on LOTW, it's on Tetu Lake which is where the English and Winnipeg Rivers meet. I've never stayed at either Tetu Lodge nor Caribou Falls Lodge which is just up river, but I've fished the area many times. Fishing is always good, but there's often a lot of competition with other lodges (KCR, Caribou Falls, and even two lodges that come in from Manitoba, so you're often sharing spots. My parents and two others fished the area in late June and had one of their best years ever. No big fish, other than one 44" pike, but non-stop walleye action.
My bad, north of Kenora. Always assumed it was north end of LOTW near Kenora.
